Others: The Knicks struggled offensively, scoring a season-low 97 points and shooting under 39%.
Josh Hart and Jalen Brunson acknowledged the team's issues with ball movement and decision-making.
Karl-Anthony Towns had a difficult night against Dillon Brooks, scoring 17 points on 7-for-17 shooting with zero 3-pointers and dealing with foul trouble.
The Rockets took advantage of the matchup, with the Knicks being outscored by 26 points in Towns' 32 minutes.
The Knicks threw 242 passes, 40 fewer than their season average, and Jalen Brunson averaged over seven seconds with the ball per touch, a second more than his season average.
